results.firPara: The Bournemouth striker Callum Wilson has committed his future to the club by signing a new four-year contract to ward off interest from several other Premier League clubs.
results.secPara: The 24-year-old, who was the subject of an offer from West Ham in May and has also been tracked by Tottenham, scored five Premier League goals in his first six starts before being ruled out for most of last season with a knee injury.
results.webTitle: Bournemouth striker Callum Wilson signs new four-year contract

results.firPara: Paris Saint-Germain have confirmed the signing of the former Newcastle United forward Hatem Ben Arfa on a two-year contract.
results.secPara: The 29-year-old moves to the French champions following the expiration of his deal with Nice, for whom he scored 18 goals last season.
results.webTitle: PSG sign Hatem Ben Arfa on two-year deal

results.firPara: Ryan Giggs is set to leave Manchester United and end a 29-year association with the club.
results.secPara: The Welshman was assistant manager to Louis van Gaal for two years before the Dutchman was sacked in May. Giggs, 42, had 12 months year on his terms but has agreed a settlement with the club, with Rui Faria, Mourinhos long-term assistant, expected to again fill the role under the new manager.
results.webTitle: Ryan Giggs set to leave Manchester United after 29 years at club

results.firPara: Got a minute? Digest the best of our latest coverage from Euro 2016 as the battle to join Portugal in the last eight continues
results.webTitle: The Euro 2016 minute: Wales and Belgium seek semi tonic

results.firPara: The Football Association is expected to approach leading figures from sport and business to contribute to an informal panel of experts set up last month to inform its work at the national football centre in Burton upon Trent.
results.secPara: The panel, headed by the St Georges Park chair, David Sheepshanks, is not related to the search for an England manager in the wake of Roy Hodgsons departure but instead will advise on the development of young players, coaching and the high performance culture around the England set-up.
results.webTitle: FA to approach leading sports figures for expert panel at St George’s Park

results.firPara: Neymar has signed a new five-year contract with Barcelona, the Spanish champions have announced.
results.secPara: Both Manchester United and Paris Saint-Germain had been linked with a move for the Brazilian forward, who has two years left on his existing deal, but Barcelona confirmed a new deal for Neymar on Friday.
results.webTitle: Barcelona confirm Neymar’s new five-year deal at Camp Nou

results.firPara: Euro 2016 is the first time Wales have reached the quarter finals of a major competition since 1958, but back then the route to the last eight was a bizarre one
results.secPara: So Wales, their team having a few excellent players and a single individual of undoubted superstar quality who plays for one of Europes great clubs, have reached the quarter-finals of a competition for which they were not even expected to qualify. It is becoming something of a habit, if a spectacularly irregular one.
results.webTitle: Wales at the 1958 World Cup: a quarter-final run with a difference

results.firPara: No England exit these days is complete without aggressive belittling of the players, and the criticism often goes way beyond their footballing deficiencies
results.secPara: Weak, shameful, craven, immature, shiftless, gloating. Lets face it, the wider mainstream media response to England going out of the Euros really has been a disgrace to our once-brave nation.
results.webTitle: Raheem Sterling and England’s players reflect us all, so why so much hate? | Barney Ronay

results.firPara: Watford have completed a deal for the Belgian defender Christian Kabasele and are also expected to confirm the purchase of Nigerian striker Isaac Success for a club record fee of £12.5m.
results.secPara: Kabasele, who is part of Belgiums squad for Euro 2016, has moved from Genk on a five-year deal for an undisclosed fee.
results.webTitle: Watford sign Belgian defender Christian Kabasele and bank on Success

results.firPara: Patrick Vieiras team lost their last meeting with the Red Bulls 7-0. Things cant get any worse, can they?
results.secPara: Patrick Vieiras team lost their last meeting with the Red Bulls 7-0. Things cant get any worse, can they?
results.webTitle: MLS weekend preview: NYC FC search for first win in Hudson River derby
